result.execSummary:
The defendant J'quard L. Burton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. J'quard L. Burton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • J'quard L. Burton was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

08:30 AM

MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defendant sentenced to 156 days in the KCJ w/156 days sentence credit given for time served.
Court costs waived;
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
Appeal rights given

Court sets matter over for sentencing on both cases, 21CF852 & 22CF7276, so parties can review the PSI in 21CF852.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Attorney Toni Young appears with Defendant J'quard L. Burton who appears in custody.  Clerk: PT
 Sworn in and testified is State's witness: Officer Albert Gonzes; Comp cross-examination by Atty Young. ST rests and moves for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
